Package sep.seeter.server

The server-side classes for you to stand up a minimal but functional Seeter server and run your client against.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Pair<L,R>
    Helper utility for Server - namely, a seet is a pair of strings (user name, line).
    Server
    Server is a minimal but adequately functional and robust Seeter server for you to develop and test your client against.
    ServerThread
    To be spawned by Server to serve one Seeter client concurrently with any other clients.

Package sep.seeter.server Description

The server-side classes for you to stand up a minimal but functional Seeter server and run your client against.

A seet is simply a pair of strings: the name (a single, non-empty alphanumeric word of maximum length 8) of the user who wrote this seet, and its body text (a single, non-empty line of maximum length 48 characters). A Seeter server records an ordered list of seets per topic (again, a non-empty alphanumeric word of maximum length 8), and allows clients to publish and fetch seets for the client-specified topic.

An instance of Server understands and communicates messages as defined in sep.seeter.net.message.
